## Definitions

The following definitions apply for day $d$ of the forecast period and half-hourly period $k \in \left\{1, \ldots, 48 \right\}$:

* $\mathbf{L}_d = (L_{d,1}, \ldots, L_{d,48})^T$ is a vector of half-hourly loads (MW)
* $L_{d,k}$ is the average power (MW)
* $\mathbf{B}_d = (B_{d,1}, \ldots, B_{d,48})^T$ is a vector of half-hourly battery charges/discharges (MW)
* $B_{d,k}$ is the average power (MW)
* $\mathcal{B}_d$ is the set of all possible battery discharge profiles subject to constraints
* $C_{d,k}$ is the total battery charge (MWh).

## Objective

$$
\min_{\mathbf{B}_d \in \mathcal{B}_d} 
\left\{ 
\max_{k\in \left\{ 32, \ldots, 42 \right\}} (L_{d,k} + B_{d,k})
\right\}
$$

## Constraints

* $-2.5 \text{ MW} \leq B_{d,k} \leq 2.5 \text{ MW}$
* $0 \text{ MWh} \leq C_{d,k} \leq 6 \text{ MWh}$
* $C_{d,k+1} \text{ MWh} = C_{d,k} \text{ MWh} + \underbrace{0.5 B_{d,k} \text{ MWh}}_{=0.5 \text{ h} \times B_{d,k} \text{ MW}}$
* $B_{d,k} \in \begin{cases} \geq 0 & k \in \left\{ 1, \ldots, 31 \right\} \\ \leq 0 & k \in \left\{ 32, \ldots, 42 \right\} \\ 0 & k > 42 \end{cases}$
* $C_{d,1} = 0 \; \forall \; d$
